intro: Isopyrum multipeltatum, commonly known as the clustered sarsaparilla, is a herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with three to five leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in umbel-like clusters, which are followed by bright red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical study.
